![Jogyesan Provincial Park (Ï°∞Í≥ÑÏÇ∞ÎèÑÎ¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)](/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970994_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Located in both Seungju-eup and Songgwang-myeon of Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do, Jogyesan Mountain has two famous Buddhist temples on it, Seonamsa Temple and Songgwangsa Temple. It is a relatively low mountain with rounded corners and a soft tranquility.

Around Seonamsa Temple there are several peaks such as Wolchulbong Peak, Janggunbong Peak and Gitdaebong Peak as well as the Ilweolseok boulder. This area is always crowded with visitors all year round due to the famous Songgwangsa and Seonamsa temples. There are hikers who visit Jogyesan Mountain as well; the mountain is known to have gradual slopes and walking paths, making it great for a light stroll. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-1577-2013| |parking:|Songgwangsa Temple Parking Lot, Seonamsa Temple Parking Lot| |restdate:|During adverse weather condition.| |usetime:|06:00-18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Hiking Course:|50 min course: Seonamsa Temple - Daegakam - Neungseon - peak
3 hr course: Songgwangsa Temple - valley - Gulmokjae Valley - Seonamsa Temple
2 hr 30 min course: Seonamsa Temple - Gulmokjae Valley - Baebawi Rock - peak
4 hr course: Songgwangsa Temple - valley - Cheonjaam - Gulmokjae - Seonamsa Temple
3 hr course: Seonamsa Temple - Daegakam - Baebawi Rock - peak - Yeonsanbong Peak - Songgwangsa Tempel | |Restricted Mountain Areas :|[Refer to the website.](http://hiking.kworks.co.kr/sub_map/map_user01.aspx)| |Mountain Not Access Period:|Seasonal Forest Fire Watches
Spring: March 2-April 30
Autumn: November 1-December 15
National Park: November 15-December 15 (Excluding Gyeongju and Taean)
* Periods and areas are subject to change based on fire weather advisories, snow/precipitation levels, and other local conditions.| |Parking Fees:|* Seonamsa Temple: Small vehicles 2,000 won / Large vehicles 3,000 won
* Songgwangsa Temple: Free| |Available Facilities:|Restaurant, drinking fountain, bench, etc.| |Admission Fees:|Admission fees apply to Seonamsa Temple (Suncheon) and Songgwangsa Temple| |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970991_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970991_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970992_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970992_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970993_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970993_image2_1.webp) ![/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970995_image2_1.webp](/2023-01-24-1674556628319/1970995_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-1577-2013](tel:+8215772013) - [üè†suncheon.go.kr](http://main.suncheon.go.kr/tour/) ```googleMap latitude: 35.0042802527 longitude: 127.2687691374 title: Seungjugoemok 1-gil, Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do ``` ## Directions [Express Bus]
From Central City Express Bus Terminal, take an express bus to Suncheon Bus Terminal. From Suncheon Bus Terminal Bus Stop, take Bus No. 1 or 111 to Seonamsa Buddhist Temple Bus Stop.

data.title: Jogyesan Provincial Park (Ï°∞Í≥ÑÏÇ∞ÎèÑÎ¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)
data.description:
Located in both Seungju-eup and Songgwang-myeon of Suncheon-si, Jeollanam-do, Jogyesan Mountain has two famous Buddhist temples on it, Seonamsa Temple and Songgwangsa Temple. It is a relatively low mountain with rounded corners and a soft tranquility.

Around Seonamsa Temple there are several peaks such as Wolchulbong Peak, Janggunbong Peak and Gitdaebong Peak as well as the Ilweolseok boulder. This area is always crowded with visitors all year round due to the famous Songgwangsa and Seonamsa temples. There are hikers who visit Jogyesan Mountain as well; the mountain is known to have gradual slopes and walking paths, making it great for a light stroll.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Geomundo Island (Í±∞Î¨∏ÎèÑ)
dataList.description: Located approximately halfway between Yeosu and Jeju Island, Geomundo Island is part of the Dadohae Maritime National Park. It is divided into Dongdo, Seodo, and Godo Islands, all of which offer scenic views of quaint towns and surrounding nature. Also, Geomundo is the access point for the famous Baekdo Island group, a spectacular array of uninhabited rock pinnacles attached with numerous legends.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangjin Night Dream (Í∞ïÏßÑ ÎÇòÏù¥Ìä∏ ÎìúÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Gangjin Night Dream is a tourism content developed to provide night tours in Gangjin. From walking tours to busking performances, flying wish lanterns, and more, visitors can experience various activities all in one package.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dolsanhang Port (ÎèåÏÇ∞Ìï≠)
dataList.description: Dolsanhang Port is located on Dolsando Island in Gunnae-ri, Yeosu-si. It is a famous market for live fresh fish and a distribution center for seafood in the area. Yeosu local seafoods such as cuttlefish, octopus, and rock bream are available, however only wholesale auction is available. Regular visitors must purchase seafood through a middleman.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dolsando Island (ÎèåÏÇ∞ÎèÑ)
dataList.description:
Dolsando is the seventh largest island in Korea and is connected to the mainland via Dolsan Bridge. Ever since construction was completed on December 15, 1984, the 450 meter-long, 11.7 meter-wide bridge has become a popular tourist attraction.

There is plenty to see on Dolsando Island including numerous scenic spots and historic sites such as Dolsan Park, Musulmok Battlefield, Jeollanam-do Fisheries Exhibition Hall, Bangjukpo Beach, Hyangiram Hermitage, and Eunjeogam Hermitage. Located beneath Dolsan Bridge is a life-sized model of a Geobukseon (Turtle Ship), which played an important role in the Korean Navy‚Äôs victories during the Imjinwaeran War (1592-1598). Visitors will also find plenty of seafood restaurants lining the paved coastal road.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dancing Sea Fountain (Ï∂§Ï∂îÎäî Î∞îÎã§Î∂ÑÏàò)
dataList.description: With water shooting up to its peak at 70 meters and a 150-meter water basin, the Dancing Sea Fountain is the biggest sea fountain in the world. The fountain puts on various shows such as music, video, and laser to entertain spectators as they look out to the ocean.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Damyang Resort Spa (Îã¥ÏñëÎ¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏ Ïò®Ï≤ú)
dataList.description: Damyang Resort is a large resort complex comprised of a hotel, spa, arboretum, and event plaza. The spa is spread over a ground floor and basement floor, with both mens and womens pools, as well as many event pools and an open-air hot spring. Additional facilities include a jjimjilbang (Korean-style sauna), skincare center, and massage center. The hot springs use water with a mix of 20 minerals, including germanium, strontium, sulfuric ions, calcium, and lithium. The mineral mix helps soothe skin, relieve stress, and improve blood circulation to prevent many diseases and ailments.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Damyang Changpyeong [Slow City] (Îã¥ÏñëÍµ∞ Ï∞ΩÌèâÎ©¥ [Ïä¨Î°úÏãúÌã∞])
dataList.description: Damyang Changpyeong Samjinae Village is a farming village that produces vegetables and fruits including tomatoes and strawberries. The name of the village goes all the way back to early Goryeo period. Changpyeong is home to many important historical figures and known for its regional foods and local produce.
dataList.author: korea-tour
